New Records: Dasun Shanaka hammered a 20-ball fastest fifty by an Sri Lankan batsman in T20 international cricket history, surpassing the previous record of 21-ball half-century held by Mahela Jayawardene against Kenya at Johannesburg in the inaugural 2007 World Twenty20 and also the fastest fifty by an Sri Lankan batsman against India in T20Is, surpassing the previous record of 21-ball half-century held by Kumar Sangakkara at Nagpur in 2009.
Axar Patel equalled a 20-ball joint fifth fastest fifty for India in T20 international and the joint second fastest fifty by an Indian batsman against Sri Lanka in T20Is, jointly with Yuvraj Singh.

Dasun Shanaka equalled a joint second most sixes hit in an innings for Sri Lanka in T20 international, jointly with Thisara Perera, Isuru Udana and Bhanuka Rajapaksa and the second most-sixes hit by an Sri Lankan batsman against India in T20Is after Kusal Perera's 7-sixes at Indore in 2017.
Axar Patel equalled a joint ninth most sixes hit in an innings for India in T20 international and the joint third most-sixes hit by an Indian batsman against Sri Lanka in T20Is.

Dasun Shanaka named Player of the match for his match-winning all-round performance to took 2-wickets in the final over of the match and after smashing a power-hitting unbeaten 56-runs knocked off facing 22-balls including 6-sixes and 2-fours with strike rate of 254.54.
Key Match Events: Sri Lanka scored 206-6 in 20 overs with top scorer by Dasun Shanaka hammered a unbeaten 56 off 22-balls.
India best bowler by Umran Malik picked up 3-wickets, Axar Patel took 2-wickets and one for Yuzvendra Chahal.
India were 57-5 to scored 190-8 in 20 overs with top scorer by Axar Patel hammered a 65 off 31-balls including 6-sixes & 3-fours with strike rate of 209.67.
Dasun Shanaka took 2-wickets in the final over of the match.
Post-Match Reflections: Dasun Shanaka named Player of the match for his match-winning all-round performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka's 206 was their second highest score against India in T20 international after their 215 at Nagpur in 2009 and It is their joint seventh highest total in T20Is.
Sri Lanka's 206 was the highest-score by any team at Pune in T20Is, previous highest was 201 by India against Sri Lanka in 2020.
India's 190 was their sixth highest score against Sri Lanka in T20 internationals.
